parsed.internal_thinking: I have placed my first settlement on Node 42, which is an exceptionally strong production spot with two Wheat 9s and an Ore 5, totaling 12 pips. This setup is ideal for a 'Cities and Development Cards' strategy, but it leaves me completely lacking in Wood, Brick, and Sheep. For my starting road, I am choosing the path toward Node 41. While Node 43 offers more pips (13), it would only provide more Wheat, which is redundant. Node 50 offers a 3:1 port but has lower overall production (8 pips). Node 41 provides 11 pips and introduces Brick 10 into my potential income, which is vital for early expansion. Furthermore, this direction leads toward Node 31 (Wood 11, Brick 10, Wheat 9) and a Wood 2:1 port at Node 40, giving me a clear expansion path to balance my resources. Since I will place my second settlement last in the next round, I will look for a spot with Sheep and Wood (like Node 20 or 10) to complete my resource base. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: My first settlement is at 42 (O5, Wh9, Wh9). I've pointed my road toward 41 (O5, Wh9, B10). Priority for the second settlement is Sheep and Wood—keep an eye on Nodes 20 (W11, B6, S8) and 10 (B6, S8, W12). If those are blocked, consider Node 12 or Node 19. Long-term, expansion to Node 31 will help secure consistent Wood and Brick income.
parsed.say_outloud: Going to point my road toward the brick at Node 41. I'm definitely going to need some building materials to go with all this wheat!
